revised_title: Researches on the Impregnation of the Ovum in Amphibia and Early Stages of Embryo Development
tldr: The author, George Viner Ellis, presents research on the impregnation of the ovum in amphibians and the early stages of embryo development. The study focuses on the process of fertilization, the role of spermatozoon, and the development of the embryo from the ovum. The findings reveal the importance of specific segments of the ovum in the formation of different parts of the embryo, including the head, trunk, and tail.
